intro: Scilla rosenii var. pulchella, commonly known as the pink scilla, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, pink or lilac-colored flowers in early spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that emerge in late winter. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
